snippet: A longtime columnist for a gun magazine questioned when the regulation of guns became infringement of the right to bear arms. He was quickly fired, squelching any debate.
abstract: Dick Metcalf, one of the country's pre-eminent gun journalists, has found himself a pariah in the gun community after he stated in his Guns & Ammo magazine column that too many gun owners believe constitution prohibits any regulation of firearms; Metcalf's experience sheds light on the close-knit world of gun journalism, where editors and reporters say there is little room for nuance in the debate over gun laws.
lead_paragraph: A longtime columnist for a gun magazine questioned when the regulation of guns became infringement of the right to bear arms. He was quickly fired, squelching any debate.

headline.main: Banished for Questioning the Gospel of Guns
headline.print_headline: Banished for Questioning the Gospel of Guns
